newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Ayala says water bid economically viable.
newsitem.headline: Ayala says water bid economically viable.

text.p: Ayala Corp is confident its bid for the privatisation of the Manila waterworks system is economically viable, a senior executive from the group said on Thursday. A consortium comprising Ayala, Bechtel Corp of the United States and United Utilities posted the lowest bids for both zones being bid out by the Metropolitan Water and Sewerage system (MWSS).

But its offer was considered the best for only the east zone under rules aimed at preventing the same group winning both concessions. A consortium comprising Benpres Holdings Corp and Lyonnaise des Eaux SA was considered to have posted the best bid for the west zone.
Antonino Aquino, a senior official in the Ayala group of companies, said winning the east zone bid would help the conglomerate provide services to many of its customers.
Ayala Land, the property group of the company, owns much of the upmarket Makati commercial and residential district, which falls in the east zone.
"This is going to be very economically viable over the lifetime (of the project)," said Aquino, who is vice-president at Ayala Land.
The MWSS has said winning bidders will be given 25-year contracts to operate water services in their respective zones.
